pull.title: Bugfix: use global ::fRelayTxes instead of CNode in version send
pull.body:
#8049 changed the calls to GetBoolArg("-blocksonly") to a global boolean `fRelayTxes`. Inside `CNode::PushVersion`, `fRelayTxes` refers to the CNode instance variable with the same name, however, causing the connecting node to always send false here, and never receive any transactions.

I've attempted to add a unit test for this, but we don't seem to ever test receiving relayed transactions by a connecting node only...

events.body: I'll work on a better test for this, but I propose merging quickly, as relay of transactions is currently broken in master.

yikes. utACK.

As an aside, we should really strive to avoid shadowing vars, and enable -Wshadow.

Also, as a follow-up, this should probably be renamed fBlocksonly so that it's more clear what it's for.

events.message: Use global ::fRelayTxes instead of CNode one

issue.title: avoid shadowing vars, and enable -Wshadow
issue.body:
I haven't looked into a fix for this, but it should be easy to implement and hopefully uncontroversial.

Relavant bug: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8102#issuecomment-221934374

TODO:
- [x] `univalue` shadowing fix (merged, synced to our tree )
- [x] `serialize.h` and `nVersion`, `nType` collisions (~~#8468~~ #9039 )
- [x] `LOCK` inside `LOCK`shadowing (using `__COUNTER__` for `LOCK` macro) (#8472)
- [x] other misc source fixes
- [x] enabling `-Wshadow` (#8794)
- [x] document `-Wshadow` and add developer notes about it (#8794)
- [ ] `leveldb` shadowing fix ? (https://github.com/google/leveldb/pull/378, but fixed by other changes there.)
- [ ] GCC Set #8808

issue.title: Enable -Wshadow by default
issue.body:
Test and enabled `-Wshadow` by default, add developer note about this change (see #8105).

As my native language is not English, I'm open to suggestions.

[Edits from maintainers allowed for easier cooperation.]
